page.title: 09Where We Live Now
page.content: { Housing in the Crosskeys Area The core housing in the area was built when the main shafts of the surround- ing pits were sunk. The first houses were built largely of dressed pennant grit blocks, some with brick pine end- ings & windows & door decorations. For an example of the age of the main housing, Waunfawr Primary School was built in 1890 and it can be presumed that the rest is the same age. By 1920 Crosskeys was virtually built, many buildings such as the Workmen's Institute and chapels playing an important part in the lives of the people. Most of the housing is on the valley floor in rows of terraces. There may have been farms on the floor but these have now gone. Small hill farms, many with Welsh long houses, are situated half-way up the mountain slopes.
